subject: AI & Agents
title: Model Cards and Transparency
description: A quick win: understand Model Cards and Transparency.

hook.text: You're about to deploy a model. What are its limits? Who tested it? On what data?

buildup.text: A model card is a document describing the model's purpose, performance, and limitations.

discovery.text: Good model cards include: training data, eval results, intended use, known biases, and failure modes.

twist.text: Most companies ship models without adequate documentation. Users discover limits the hard way.

climax.text: Transparency builds trust. Publish model cards for every model you deploy.

punchline.text: If you can't document it, don't deploy it.

quiz.question: What should a model card include?
options: Training data, eval results, biases, and intended use
